body.p: Web Author should be deployed in its own server so that it does not share the same JVM with other web applications.

ol.li: In the WebSphere web console, select Servers -> Server Types -> WebSphere application servers and choose the server that will run Web Author
Under Server Infrastructure expand Java and Process Management and click Process definition.
Under Additional Properties section(right), select Java Virtual Machine
In General Properties section, put 256 for Initial heap size and 1536 for Maximum heap size.

In the Generic JVM arguments add the -Dcom.ibm.websphere.jaxrs.server.DisableIBMJAXRSEngine=true entry. This will disable built-in JAX-RS support ( https://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSAW57_8.0.0/com.ibm.websphere.nd.doc/info/ae/ae/twbs_jaxrs_disable_runtime.html ).
Click Apply button an then the Save link that appears on the top of the page.

section.title: Configure the cookie handling
section.p: Set an option to allow cookie expiry dates with years stored on 4 digits (by default the have the millennium problem, i.e. 2084 is represented as '84 which is the same as 1984). The option is named v0CookieDateRFC1123compat and more details about the configuration can be found here https://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS7K4U_8.5.5/com.ibm.websphere.nd.doc/ae/rrun_chain_httpcustom.html

ol.li: Select the server as on previous section
Under Container Settings section (right) expand Web Container Settings and select Web container transport chains.
Select the HttpQueueInboundDefaultSecure entry and then HTTP inbound channel (HTTP_4)
Under Additional Properties section (right) select Custom properties and click the New button.
Add the v0CookieDateRFC1123compat property name with the value true.
Click the Save link that appears on the top of the page.
Restart the server.

section.title: Install Web Author
section.p: Now, the application can be deployed:

ol.li: In WebSphere web console, expand the Applications section and Application Types under it.
Select Websphere enterprise applications, and uninstall any previous Web Author installations.
Under Applications section select New Application
Click on New Enterprise Application.
Chooser for the .war file, press Next and wait until the next screen appears.
Choose Fast Path and click Next until the 4th step.
Set the Context Root to /oxygenxml-web-author/.
Click Next at every step and then Finish
After the processing is done click the Save link that appears on the bottom of the page.

section.title: Configure Web Author
section.p:
Set the application class-loader to be parent-last:
Go to Applications > Application Types > WebSphere enterprise applications
Choose the Web Author application
Under the Modules section(right) click Manage Modules
Click on the oxygenxml-web-author module
Set the Class loader order option to Classes loaded with the local class-loader first (parent-last).
Click Apply and then the Save link when it appears.
Restart the server.
